DataElement.preferredName: Pain Medication Tooth Second Oral Cavity Quadrant Use Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator related to the use of a drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings associated with a tooth, hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates of the mouth for the second quadrant assessed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pain Medication Tooth Second Oral Cavity Quadrant Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the use of a drug or medicine that treats or prevents or alleviates the sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings associated with a tooth, hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates of the mouth for the second quadrant assessed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredName: Tooth Second Oral Cavity Quadrant Use
Property.preferredDefinition: is an organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton. Example(s): incisor, molar.:Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.:One quarter of a circle. In anatomy, one part of an area divided into quarters for descriptive purposes.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: The hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates; primarily used for eating.
Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.
One quarter of a circle. In anatomy, one part of an area divided into quarters for descriptive purposes.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
